clear: whoops lol
hey guys, my router assigns my computer an ip, but i need it to assign the same ip every time, any ideas?
-> pretty much should be same in the next acquisition, look for the leases in /var/lib/dhcp
the files in there are empty
-> files in /var/lib/dhcp3 ?
-> are you using dhclient ?
-> how are you acquiring your ip address now ?
-> can you post your interfaces file?
http://pastebin.ca/1349251
-> you have a static address assignment so what is the issue?
the connection is not working anymore, even though it should, and it worked fine under nm
-> thats because you dont have the correct configs,  man iwconfig  to include the AP essid and whatever else is needed
still not functional, i set the essid, key, channel to auto, ap and is still not working
-> post it again
http://pastebin.ca/1349255
i dont think it looks right.. its something like  wireless-essid  xxxxx
i think i have to edit resolv.conf
-> see step 5 on this  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/WirelessTroubleShootingGuide
-> rather see step 4 on this  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/WirelessTroubleShootingGuide
im making these changes, but its still not working at all. i dont understand, it really should work
-> i stepped out, did you try   sudo ifdown wlan0; sudo ifup wlan0   ?
i ended up reinstalling network-manager and setting the static details using that, and it worked fine
